org.kaaproject.kaa.client

Class Kaa

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kaaproject.kaa.client.Kaa

  • public abstract class Kaa
extends Object

    Entry point to the Kaa library.

    Responsible for the Kaa initialization and start/stop actions. Contains abstract method createClient() for AbstractKaaClient concrete object creation. All manipulations using Kaa library should be accessed through KaaClient interface.

    WARNING: Calling getClient() without previously initialized Kaa library (init()) will return null and will cause NullPointerException when attempting to use Kaa client functionality.

    Available implementations can be found in Maven projects client-java-android and client-java-desktop

    .
    Example
     // Start Kaa
 Kaa kaa = new SomeKaaImpl();
 kaa.start();

 // Stop Kaa:
 kaa.stop();

 // Accessing KaaClient:
 KaaClient kaaClient = kaa.getClient();
 ...
 }
    Author:
    Yaroslav Zeygerman
    See Also:
    KaaClient, AbstractKaaClient

        public Kaa()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        protected void init()
             throws Exception

        Initialize Kaa library.

        Each call forces KaaClient to be reinitialized. All current processes will be stopped and new client will be created using createClient() and start() should be called as client will not start automatically.

        Throws:
        Exception

      • createClient

        protected abstract AbstractKaaClient createClient()
                                           throws Exception
        Creates platform-specific AbstractKaaClient object.
        Returns:
        Instance of AbstractKaaClient
        Throws:
        Exception

      • start

        public void start()
           throws IOException,
                  TransportException

        Starts Kaa's workflow.

        Should be called after each call to init().

        Throws:
        IOException
        TransportException
        See Also:
        AbstractKaaClient.start()

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops Kaa's workflow.
        See Also:
        AbstractKaaClient.stop()

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pauses Kaa's workflow.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resumes Kaa's workflow.

      • getClient

        public KaaClient getClient()

        Retrieves the Kaa client.

        Use this to access Kaa library functionality.

        Returns:
        Kaa client.
        See Also:
        KaaClient
